task: You are given a preprocessed injured mouse kidney Xenium dataset (300-gene panel) with per-cell spatial centroids. Identify the present cell populations and then normalize your labels to a standard kidney-injury vocabulary using marker-based merging and common synonyms (do not invent new categories). Examples of normalization only (not exhaustive): merge proximal tubule subtypes (e.g., PTS1/PTS2/PTS3) → PT; merge intercalated subtypes (e.g., ICA/ICB) → IC; glomerular endothelial variants → EC; keep Inj_PT and FR_PT as distinct categories. Return EXACTLY: <EVAL_ANSWER>{"cell_types_predicted": ["TypeA", "TypeB", "..."], "label_mapping": {"your_original_label": "canonical_label"}}</EVAL_ANSWER>. "cell_types_predicted" must be the UNIQUE SET of your CANONICAL labels after mapping.

scoring.set_definition: Compare the SET of unique predicted CANONICAL labels (after the agent's mapping) against ground_truth_labels; extras increase the union and lower the score; exact string match required.
